text.section:
In this section "designee" means:
a support enforcement agency that is authorized by law to receive alimony payments for the recipient; or
a person who is designated by the court as trustee or guardian to receive alimony payments for the recipient.
The court may order that alimony payments be made to a designee.

A designee shall:
send the payments to the recipient; and
keep a record of:
the amount of each payment;
the date that each payment must be made; and
the name and address of each party.

Each party shall inform the designee of:
any change of address; or
any other fact that might affect the administration of the order.
If the party who is required to pay alimony fails to make a payment, the designee or the recipient may bring an enforcement proceeding.
The State's Attorney may represent the designee in any enforcement proceeding that is brought under this section.
